title: Washington-Rochambeau National Historic Trail: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           Washington-Rochambeau National Historic Trail  Attention: Superintendent, National Park Service 200 Chestnut Street,  3rd Floor  Philadelphia, PA 19016                 Directions         The Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route NHT encompasses over 680 miles of land and water trails through Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia and Washington D.C.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Washington-Rochamebeau National Historic Trail The Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route NHT can be travelled year-round. The NHT connects national, state, and local parks as well a great number of historic sites and landmarks. Visitors should contact sites or attractions individually as operating hours vary widely by site and season.   Standard Hours    Sunday: Open 24 hours   Monday: Open 24 hours   Tuesday: Open 24 hours   Wednesday: Open 24 hours   Thursday: Open 24 hours   Friday: Open 24 hours   Saturday: Open 24 hours             Weather           With over 680 miles of land and water trails and hundreds of historical sites, there is a wide variety in weather. Please check with your favorite weather website before traveling.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Washington-Rochambeau Fee - $0.00 There is no fee to explore the Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail, but fees may apply for sites and attractions along the trail. Visitors should contact sites individually for further information.
